title: Emmerdale spoilers: Aaron plots to break Robert out of prison
text:
Aaron Dingle’s (Danny Miller) world came crashing down in Emmerdale when husband Robert Sugden (Ryan Hawley) turned himself in to the police to prevent him from having to live life on the run. Tonight, Aaron set about speaking with his husband, and — after thinking over what to do for the best — he set a shocking plan in motion.

Disaster struck during last night’s episode when DS Wise (Neil Roberts) tailed Chas (Lucy Pargeter) and Paddy (Dominic Brunt) to the cottage where Robert and Aaron were hiding out. Meanwhile, with Robert aware of how husband Aaron would be forced to abandon his family if he were to go on the run, he decided to turn himself over the police.

Aaron was understandably devastated by Robert’s decision, and tonight, he struggled to come to terms with everything that had transpired. Liv (Isobel Steele), Chas and Paddy tires to make an irate Aaron see that what Robert done was what was best for everyone, but Aaron was having none of it, and — with his frustrations growing — he took his anger out on all those around him.

After trying desperately to get in touch with Robert, Robert phoned him and — after explaining his motivations for turning himself in — he confirmed that he’s been charged with murder — a revelation which left Aaron devastated.

As the episode came to a close, Aaron picked up his phone and rang an unidentified contact, and — upon said person answering the call — he informed them that, as they own him a favour, he wants this person’s help in breaking someone out of prison.

Will Aaron follow through with his idea?

Robert certainly wouldn’t want him to take the risk, but Aaron’s not thinking rationally right now, as he’s too intent on getting the love of his life back in his arms.

Emmerdale continues on Friday 18th October at 7pm on ITV.
